---
title: Spontaneous recovery
---


Spontaneous recovery refers to the restoration of function in neural tissues initially lost after injury, resulting from naturally occurring repair processes within the CNS @osullivanImprovingFunctionalOutcomes2016

:::{.callout-note}
## Example of spontaneous recovery
For example, the patient with stroke regains some motor function approximately 2 to 3 weeks after insult as cerebral edema resolves @osullivanImprovingFunctionalOutcomes2016
:::
